courseInfo.program: Electronics and Communications Engineering, Power Electronics
courseInfo.branch: Electronics and Communications Engineering, Power Electronics

rationale: Need of knowledge about fundamental electrical concepts is vital to work in any industry related to Power Electronics and Electronics and Communications. Hence this course aims at development of knowledge and skills related with Electrical engineering basics, so that it can be applied for the understanding of further courses associated with their discipline areas.
competency: Use principles of electrical engineering in solving branch specific engineering problems.

courseOutcomes.description: Apply fundamentals of DC circuits and batteries in relevant engineering discipline.
Apply fundamentals of AC circuits in relevant engineering discipline.
Use principles of electromagnetic induction in applications related with relevant engineering discipline.
Classify green energy sources with emphasis on working of solar and wind power plant.

unitOutcomes.description: Explain electrical parameters related with DC supply.
Distinguish basic electrical components.
Explain effect of temperature on resistance.
Determine voltage, current and resistance in electrical circuit using Ohm's law.
Apply Kirchhoff's voltage and current law for given electrical circuit.
Calculate equivalent resistance for given connection.
Select relevant battery for given application.

topics.title: Idea of Electric Potential, EMF, Current, Power and Energy
Introduction of Resistor, Inductor and Capacitor
Effect of temperature on resistance of conductor
Ohm's law: Applications and limitations
Kirchhoff's voltage law and Kirchhoff's current law
Types of connections: series and parallel connections of resistors
Battery: Concept of cell and battery, Rating of battery, Series and parallel connection of batteries, Applications

unitOutcomes.description: Explain generation of alternating EMF.
Define parameters related to alternating waveform.
Describe behavior of pure resistor, inductor and capacitor with AC supply.
Explain concept of power triangle and power factor.
Explain the generation of 3-phase alternating EMF.
Describe different 3 phase electrical connection.

topics.title: Generation of Alternating EMF
Basic Terminology: Cycle, Time-period, Amplitude, Frequency, RMS value, Average value, Form factor, Peak factor
Pure resistor, inductor and capacitor with AC supply
Power triangle and power factor
Generation of 3-phase alternating EMF
Types of 3-phase connection: Star & Delta connection with vector diagram

unitOutcomes.description: Describe phenomenon of electromagnetic induction.
Apply Faraday's law, Lenz's law, Fleming's right hand rule, Fleming's left hand rule.
Differentiate statically and dynamically induced EMF, self and mutual inductance.
Identify the different types of inductors and explain their applications.
Calculate the energy stored in magnetic field.

topics.title: Electromagnetic Induction
Faraday's law, Lenz's law, Fleming's right hand rule for Generators, Fleming's left hand rule for Motors
Statically and dynamically induced EMF
Inductance: Self and Mutual inductance
Types of Inductor
Energy stored in Magnetic field

unitOutcomes.description: Justify the need of green energy.
Classify sources of green energy.
Explain block diagram of solar power plant.
Explain block diagram of wind power plant.

topics.title: Need of green energy
Classification of green energy
Solar energy: PV cell, Panel and Arrays, Block diagram of solar power system, Solar roof top
Wind energy: Types of wind turbine, Block diagram of wind power system

practicalExercises.description: Find equivalent resistance for series connection.
Find equivalent resistance for parallel connection.
Find equivalent voltage for series and parallel connection of batteries.
Measure power consumption using wattmeter and energy meter.
Use digital meters like multi-meter, clip-on meter.
Measure voltage, current and power and power factor in single phase AC circuit.
Measure voltage, current power and power factor in 3 phase AC circuit
Verify relationship between voltage and current for 3-phase star connection.
Verify relationship between voltage and current for 3-phase delta connection.
Identify different kinds of inductor and its applications
Identify components of solar power system.
Identify components of wind power system.

performanceIndicators.indicator: Operate the equipment setup or circuit.

hardware: Variable DC power supply: 0- 30 V, 2 A, SC protection, display for voltage and current

Discrete Component Trainer/ Analog Component Trainer: Fixed and variable D.C. Supplies, AC Supplies, Actual Components like transistors, SCR, LDR, photo diode, resistors, capacitors, inductors, diodes, LED's, transformers, 2 mm patch cords for interconnecting components
Single phase auto-transformer: Single phase, 0- 230 V, 10 A
Digital Multimeter: 3 1/2 digit display, 9999 counts digital multimeter measures: Vac, Vdc (1000 V max) , Adc, Aac (10 amp max) , Resistance ( 0 - 100 M) , Capacitance and Temperature measurement
Clamp on meter: AC/DC current up to 40 A, 600 V
Solar Energy Demonstration Kit (Meters, Chargeable Batteries, with sample load)
Wind Energy demonstration kit or Wind turbine working Model (Small capacity)

affectiveDomainOutcomes: Work as a leader/a team member.
Follow safety practices while using electrical equipment.
studentActivities: Calculate total installed electrical load of any premises.
Give seminar on innovation in renewable energy sources.
instructionalStrategies: Massive open online courses (MOOCs) may be used to teach various topics/sub topics.
'L' in section No. 4 means different types of teaching methods that are to be employed by teachers to develop the outcomes.
About 20% of the topics/sub-topics which are relatively simpler or descriptive in nature is to be given to the students for self-learning, but to be assessed using different assessment methods.
With respect to section No.10, teachers need to ensure to create opportunities and provisions for co-curricular activities.
Guide students on how to address issues on environment and sustainability.
Guide students for using data manuals.

microProjects.title: Demonstration kit
microProjects.description: Prepare demonstration kit for various electrical laws that has been part of the course.

microProjects.title: Components
microProjects.description: Prepare a chart for commonly used resistors, inductors and capacitors used in different domestic appliances (name of appliances with type and ratings)

microProjects.title: LED tube light
microProjects.description: Build and test the LED lamp circuit for its proper working.

microProjects.title: Power Factor Improvement
microProjects.description: Visit a nearby sub-station and observe the use of power capacitors for power factor improvement and prepare a report.

microProjects.title: Solar/Wind power generation in India
microProjects.description: Prepare a report on current installed capacity of RES with emphasis on solar and wind including the growth in last 10 years (From government websites)

microProjects.title: Energy Consumption and safety
microProjects.description: Compile a report regarding energy consumption of a house.
